questions.question: The tweezers must be in the cupboard ...................... the sink
questions.description: Below and under can both mean ‘lower than’.

questions.question: If she doesn’t come soon, we will ……………….. without her.
questions.description: There is usually no difference between begin and start.

questions.question: I don’t like this shirt. ……………….., it is too expensive.
questions.description: Besides can mean also. Beside means next to or at the side of.

questions.question: He is still ……………….. eighteen.
questions.description: We use under to mean younger than.

questions.question: A lot of businesses are going ……………… because of the economic crisis.
I came up ………………… the magistrate for dangerous driving.
questions.description: We use ‘before’ to mean ‘in the presence of somebody important’.

questions.question: ………………. I worked fast, I finished early.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. We use it before a clause. Because of is a preposition. We use it before a noun.

questions.question: He ……………….. 72 kilos.
questions.description: Weigh is one of those verbs that are not used in the continuous form.

questions.question: As well as ………………… his arm, he hurt his leg.
questions.description: When we put a verb after as well as, we most often use the –ing form.

questions.question: You can take my car …………………. you drive carefully.
The house ………………. I live is very small.
questions.description: That cannot be used instead of where.

questions.question: I ……………….. a lot of interesting experiences during my year in Africa.
questions.description: Experience is generally used with the verb have.
